persName.roleName: 3rd Duke of Queensberry and 2nd Duke of Dover

note.p: Career: Travelled on the Continent (1711-1718); Lord of the Bedchamber to George I (1720-1727); Lord Lieutenant of Dumfriesshire and Kirkcudbrightshire (1721); Vice-Admiral of Scotland (1722-1729); Privy Councillor (1726-1728, 1760); Gentleman of the Bedchamber to Frederick, Prince of Wales (1733-1751); Captain General of the Royal Company of Archers (1758-death); Keeper of the Great Seal of Scotland (1761-1763); Lord Justice General for Scotland (1763-death); died of mortification in the leg following an accident when alighting from his carriage
Honours: Earl of Sallway [Solway], Viscount Tibberis and Lord Douglas of Lockerbie, Dalveen and Thornhill 1706
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; GEC; Foster
Notes: Succeeded to his father's honours in July 1711. Proposed by James Douglas
